greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = gcd(P+p, P*p) where P is the largest and p the smallest prime factor of n.
example: If n is prime q > 2, then a(n) = gcd(q^2, 2q) = q.
mathematica: PrimeFactors[n_Integer] := Flatten[ Table[ # [[1]], {1}] & /@ FactorInteger[n]]; f[n_] := Block[{pf = PrimeFactors[n]}, GCD[pf[[1]] + pf[[ -1]], pf[[1]]*pf[[ -1]] ]]; Table[ f[n], {n, 2, 97}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 04 2004 *)
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Oct 28 2004
